member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.WpfConverter
member.summary: This is a static class used to convert an AtalaImage to a BitmapSource and back.

example.code:
Dim dlg As Microsoft.Win32.OpenFileDialog = New Microsoft.Win32.OpenFileDialog() dlg.Filter = "Images|*.jpg;*.png;*.tif;*.gif;*.bmp;*.wdp;*.xps" If dlg.ShowDialog(Me).Value Then Dim image As Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage = New Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage(dlg.FileName) Dim source As BitmapSource = WpfConverter.AtalaImageToBitmapSource(image) image.Dispose()
Me.Viewer.Source = source End If

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.WpfConverter.AtalaImageToBitmapSource(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage)
member.summary: Converts an AtalaImage to a BitmapSource.
member.returns: A BitmapSource for the image.
member.remarks: The AtalaImage can be disposed after the conversion to free up memory.
member.param: The AtalaImage to convert.

member.remarks: The image data is copied from the BitmapSource. After processing the AtalaImage, a new BitmapSource can be created from the method.

summary.para: The AtalaImageViewer is an image viewer with automatic zooming and mouse tool capabilities.

The viewer takes advantage of DotImage codecs to and images and image commands can be applied to the image using the method. The viewer contains a property for a BitmapSource object, making its use in WPF straight forward.

example.code: <Window x:Class="WpfControlsDemo.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:mc="clr-namespace:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf;assembly=Atalasoft.dotImage.Wpf" Title="WPF Controls Demo" Height="565" Width="756" Background="White" > <Grid> <Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <ColumnDefinition/> </Grid.ColumnDefinitions> <Grid.RowDefinitions> <RowDefinition Height="22"/> <RowDefinition/> <RowDefinition Height="22"/> </Grid.RowDefinitions> <Menu Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="0"> <MenuItem Header="_File"> <MenuItem Header="_Open" Click="OnOpenFile"/> <MenuItem Header="_Save" Click="OnSaveFile"/> <Separator/> <MenuItem Header="E_xit" Click="OnExit"/> </MenuItem> </Menu> <mc:AtalaImageViewer Name="Viewer" Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="1" ImageChanged="OnImageChanged" MouseMovePixel="OnViewerMouseMove"> <mc:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> <mc:SelectionMouseTool SelectionChanged="MySelectionChanged"/> </mc:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> </mc:AtalaImageViewer> <StatusBar Name="statusBar1" Grid.Column="0" Grid.Row="2" VerticalAlignment="Bottom"> <StatusBarItem> <TextBlock Name="statusInfo"></TextBlock> </StatusBarItem> </StatusBar> </Grid> </Window>

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.Save(System.IO.Stream,Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.ImageEncoder,Atalasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventHandler)
member.summary: Saves the image into a stream using the provided encoder.
member.exception: Thrown if the stream or encoder argument is null (Nothing in VB).

example.code: Private Sub OnSaveFile(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As RoutedEventArgs) Dim dlg As Microsoft.Win32.SaveFileDialog = New Microsoft.Win32.SaveFileDialog() dlg.Filter = "PNG|*.png|HD Photo|*.wdp" If dlg.ShowDialog().Value Then Using fs As FileStream = New FileStream(dlg.FileName, FileMode.Create, FileAccess.Write) If dlg.FilterIndex = 1 Then Me.Viewer.Save(fs, New Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.PngEncoder(), Nothing) Else Me.Viewer.Save(fs, New Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder(), Nothing) End If End Using End If End Sub

member.param: A stream where the image will be saved.
The ImageEncoder to use when saving the image.
A ProgressEventHandler used to provide progress during the save process. This can be null (Nothing in VB).

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.ApplyCommand(Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageCommand)
member.summary: Applies a command to the current image.

example.code:
Private Sub ApplyCommand(ByVal command As Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageCommand) Try If command Is Nothing Then Return End If
' If the selection tool is in use and the command ' supports region of interest, set it. Dim regCmd As Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageRegionCommand = TryCast(command, Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.ImageRegionCommand) If regCmd IsNot Nothing Then regCmd.RegionOfInterest = GetRegionOfInterest() End If
Me.Viewer.ApplyCommand(command)
' In case there is a selection used, clear it. If Me.Viewer.MouseTool IsNot Nothing Then Me.Viewer.MouseTool.Bounds = New Rect() End If Catch ex As Exception MessageBox.Show("There was an exception while processing a command." Constants.vbCrLf Constants.vbCrLf ex.Message, "Error") End Try End Sub

member.exception: Thrown if the command argument is null (Nothing in VB).
member.param: The image command to apply.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.PointToImage(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: This method returns the image pixel position at the specified viewer coordinate.
member.returns: The image pixel at the specified coordinate.
member.remarks: This method performs a simple conversion of the point and does not validate the position. This could result in return values that are outside of the image area.
member.param: The viewer coordinate to convert.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.PointFromImage(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: This method converts an image pixel position to viewer coordinate space.
member.returns: A point containing the viewer position.
member.remarks: This method performs a simple conversion of the point and does not validate the position. This could result in return values that are outside of the viewable area.

example.code:
Private Function CenterIsVisible() As Boolean ' Find the center of the image in client space. Dim x As Integer = Me.Viewer.Image.Width / 2 Dim y As Integer = Me.Viewer.Image.Height / 2
Dim clientPoint As Point = Me.Viewer.PointFromImage(New Point(x, y))
' Return true if this point is visible. Return (clientPoint.X > 0 AndAlso clientPoint.Y > 0 AndAlso clientPoint.X < Me.Viewer.ClientSize.Width AndAlso clientPoint.Y < Me.Viewer.ClientSize.Height) End Function

member.param: The image pixel to convert.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.ScrollIntoView(System.Windows.Point,System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls an image pixel into view if it is not currently within the viewable area.

example.code:
' Find the center-most pixel of the image. Dim x As Integer = Me.Viewer.Image.Width / 2 Dim y As Integer = Me.Viewer.Image.Height / 2
' Make sure it's within the viewable area. Me.Viewer.ScrollIntoView(New Point(x, y), 10)

member.param: The image pixel to bring into view.

The number of pixels around the viewable area that will trigger a scroll. If the image pixel is within the viewable area but falls within this padding, it will be scrolled to force it outside of the padded area.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.ScrollImagePixel(System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Scrolls an image pixel to the specified viewer coordinates.

example.code:
' Find the center-most pixel of the image. Dim x As Integer = Me.Viewer.Image.Width / 2 Dim y As Integer = Me.Viewer.Image.Height / 2
' Find the control's visual center. Dim x2 As Integer = CInt(Fix(Me.Viewer.ClientSize.Width)) / 2 Dim y2 As Integer = CInt(Fix(Me.Viewer.ClientSize.Height)) / 2
' Scroll the image so its center-most pixel is ' centered within the control. Me.Viewer.ScrollImagePixel(New Point(x, y), New Point(x2, y2))

member.param: The image pixel to move.
The position on the viewer where the pixel should be placed.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.CenterInViewer(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Scrolls the image to center a pixel within the viewer (if possible).
member.remarks: The pixel provided cannot always be centered in the viewer. For example, passing in point {0, 0} will show that pixel at the top left corner of the viewer because the image cannot be scrolled past this point.
member.param: The pixel to center.
member.overloads: These methods will attempt to scroll a pixel or rectangular area to the center of the viewer.

example.code:
' Add an event handler for the MouseUp event. Private Me.Viewer.MouseUp += New MouseButtonEventHandler(AddressOf Viewer_MouseUp)
'...
Sub Viewer_MouseUp(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As MouseButtonEventArgs) If Me.Viewer.Image Is Nothing Then Return End If
Dim pt As Point = Me.Viewer.PointToImage(e.GetPosition(Me.Viewer)) Me.Viewer.CenterInViewer(pt) End Sub

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.CenterInViewer(System.Windows.Rect,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Centers a rectangle, optionally changing the zoom level to fit the rectangle within the viewer.
member.param: The rectangle to center.
If true, the zoom level will be modified to fit the entire rectangle within the viewer. Setting this to false may not show the entire rectangular area within the viewer.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.Zoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom level applied to the image.
member.value: The zoom level applied to the image.
member.remarks: A zoom value of 1.0 will display the image at normal size. Values greater than zero but less than 1.0 will reduce the size and values larger than 1.0 will increase the size.
member.exception: Thrown if the value is less than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AtalaImageViewer.IsColorManaged
member.summary: Get or set a value indicating if the control will automatically color correct images.
member.value: A value indicating if the control will automatically color correct images.
member.remarks: When true, the control uses the DisplayProfile and the ColorProfile of the image to display to transform the colors to the display's colorspace. If the OutputProfile is not null, then the image will be proofed to the OutputProfile.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.MouseToolBehavior.MultiClick
member.summary: The selection is created by making two mouse clicks; one for the each opposite corner of the selection. This is useful for users that may have a hard time dragging the mouse with a button pressed.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.MouseToolBehavior.ClickAndDrag
member.summary: The selection is created by hold down a mouse button and dragging.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.SelectionMouseToolType.Freehand
member.summary: A freehand selection.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AutoZoomMode
member.summary: Describes the type of automatic zooming to perform on the image.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AutoZoomMode.None
member.summary: No action is taken.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AutoZoomMode.BestFit
member.summary: Zoom is calculated so the entire image can be seen in the viewer without scrollbars.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AutoZoomMode.BestFitReduceOnly
member.summary: The same as BestFit but will not perform a zoom if the image is smaller than the viewer.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AutoZoomMode.FitToWidth
member.summary: Zoom is calculated so the image will fit the width of the viewer.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.AutoZoomMode.FitToHeight
member.summary: Zoom is calculated so the image will fit the height of the viewer.

member.summary: The zoom level is increased.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.ZoomToolMode.ZoomOut
member.summary: The zoom level is decreased.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.ZoomToolMode.ZoomSelection

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.MagnifierMouseTool
member.summary: This tool is used to provide a magnified area of the image. Use this class by setting the AtalaViewer.MouseTool property to an instance of the MagnifierMouseTool class.
This mouse tool is used to magnify an area of the image. The end-user initiates magnification by pressing a mouse button on the image. Releasing the mouse button will hide the magnifier.

example.code: <Window x:Class="WpfControlsDemo.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:atala="clr-namespace:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf;assembly=Atalasoft.dotImage.Wpf" Title="WPF Controls Demo" Height="565" Width="756" Background="White" > <Grid> <atala:AtalaImageViewer Name="Viewer"> <atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> <atala:MagnifierMouseTool Size="120,120" Magnification="2.0"> <atala:MagnifierMouseTool.Pen> <Pen Thickness="1"> <Pen.Brush> <SolidColorBrush Color="Black"/> </Pen.Brush> </Pen> </atala:MagnifierMouseTool.Pen> </atala:MagnifierMouseTool> </atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> </atala:AtalaImageViewer> </Grid> </Window>
Me.Viewer.MouseTool = New MagnifierMouseTool(New Size(120, 120), 2, New Pen(New SolidColorBrush(Colors.Black), 1))
this.Viewer.MouseTool = new MagnifierMouseTool(new Size(120, 120), 2, new Pen(new SolidColorBrush(Colors.Black), 1));

If the problem still exists, please, contact with system administrator for further assistance..

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.Properties.Resources.xpsLibrary_not_found
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The library is corrupt. Try to reinstall Atalasoft dotImage and restart an application. If the problem still exists, please, contact with technical support for further assistance..

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.Properties.Resources.xpsLibrary_not_loaded
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An error has occured in attempt to initialize Atalasoft.XPS.lib.dll. See the inner exception for additional technical details..

summary.para: The SelectionMouseTool provides the ability for end-users to select an area of the image for processing.

The tool can be animated using the built-in animation feature or by providing custom animation. A masked selection feature is provided which (by default) will darken the image except for the selected area. This effect can be modified by setting the property.

example.code: <Window x:Class="WpfControlsDemo.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:atala="clr-namespace:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf;assembly=Atalasoft.dotImage.Wpf" Title="WPF Controls Demo" Height="565" Width="756" Background="White" > <Grid> <atala:AtalaImageViewer Name="Viewer"> <atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> <atala:SelectionMouseTool/> </atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> </atala:AtalaImageViewer> </Grid> </Window>
Me.Viewer.MouseTool = New SelectionMouseTool()
this.Viewer.MouseTool = new SelectionMouseTool();

example.code: <Window x:Class="WpfControlsDemo.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:atala="clr-namespace:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf;assembly=Atalasoft.dotImage.Wpf" Title="WPF Controls Demo" Height="565" Width="756" Background="White" > <Grid> <atala:AtalaImageViewer Name="Viewer"> <atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> <atala:SelectionMouseTool AspectRatio="1.5"/> </atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> </atala:AtalaImageViewer> </Grid> </Window>
Me.Viewer.MouseTool = SelectionMouseTool tool = New SelectionMouseTool() tool.AspectRatio = 1.5 Me.Viewer.MouseTool = tool

member.remarks: Setting AspectRatio to zero will disable the feature.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf.ZoomMouseTool
member.summary: This tool is used to zoom in and out of an image by either clicking a mouse button or selecting an area of the image which will be zoomed to fit in the viewer.

example.code: <Window x:Class="WpfControlsDemo.Window1" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:atala="clr-namespace:Atalasoft.Imaging.Wpf;assembly=Atalasoft.dotImage.Wpf" Title="WPF Controls Demo" Height="565" Width="756" Background="White" > <Grid> <atala:AtalaImageViewer Name="Viewer"> <atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> <atala:ZoomMouseTool ZoomChangePercentage="0.2" LeftButtonTool="ZoomSelection"/> </atala:AtalaImageViewer.MouseTool> </atala:AtalaImageViewer> </Grid> </Window>
Me.Viewer.MouseTool = New ZoomMouseTool(0.2, False, False, MouseToolBehavior.ClickAndDrag, Nothing, Colors.White, Nothing, True, ZoomToolMode.ZoomSelection, ZoomToolMode.None, ZoomToolMode.None)
this.Viewer.MouseTool = new ZoomMouseTool(0.2, false, false, MouseToolBehavior.ClickAndDrag, null, Colors.White, null, true, ZoomToolMode.ZoomSelection, ZoomToolMode.None, ZoomToolMode.None);

member.summary: The JpegXrEncoder class is an encoder that is used to encode an AtalaImage to Microsoft Windows Media Photo images.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of JpegXrEncoder.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.AlphaDataDiscardLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of alpha frequency data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.
member.value: The level of alpha data to discard when encoding the image. The value range is 0 to 4. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: This parameter is only valid if is set to true and the image contains either a planar or interleaved alpha channel; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.AlphaQualityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression quality for a planar alpha channel.
member.value: The compression quality for a planar alpha channel image. A value of 1 is considered lossless and increasing values result in higher compression ratios and lower image quality. The value range is 0 to 255. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: This parameter is only valid if is false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.CompressedDomainTranscode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether compressed domain operations can be used. Compressed domain operations are transformation operations that are done without decoding the image data.
member.value: True if compressed domain operations can be used; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.FlipHorizontal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to flip the image horizontally.
member.value: True if the image is to be flipped horizontally; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.FlipVertical
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to flip the image vertically.
member.value: True if the image is to be flipped vertically; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.FrequencyOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encoding in frequency order.
member.value: True to encode the image in frequency order; false to encode the image by its spatial orientation. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.HorizontalTileSlices
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two horizontal regions.
member.value: The number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default value is 0.

remarks.para: If is true, HorizontalTileSlices must be set to 0.
A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value will be adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size.
When used in combination with , a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both property has one division, the image will be divided into 4 tiles.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.IgnoreOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to ignore region overlap pixels in sub-region compressed domain encoding. This feature is not currently implemented.
member.value: True if overlap is ignored; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This value is only valid when is true and a sub-region encode is requested.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.ImageDataDiscardLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of image data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.
member.value: The level of image data to discard during a compressed domain encoding of the image. The value range is 0 to 3. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: This parameter is only valid if is set to true; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.ImageQualityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the image quality level.
member.value: The image quality level. The range is 0 to 1.0. The default value is 0.9. A value of 1.0 represents a lossless image quality.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.InterleavedAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encode the alpha channel data as an additional interleaved channel.
member.value: True if the image is encoded with an additional interleaved alpha channel; false if planar alpha channel is used. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Interleaved alpha channels are only supported by certain pixel formats.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.Lossless
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encode using lossless compression.
member.value: True to use lossless compression; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.OverlapLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the overlap processing level.
member.value: The overlap processing level. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.QualityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression quality for the main image.
member.value: The compression quality for the main image. A value of 1 is considered lossless and higher values indicate a high compression ratio and lower image quality. The range is 0 to 255. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the Rotation of the image.
member.value: The rotation of the image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.SubsamplingLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the sub sampling level for RGB image encoding.
member.value: The sub sampling level for RGB image encoding. The range is 0 to 3. The default value is 3.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.UseCodecOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates codec options are to be used.
member.value: True if codec options are to be used; otherwise, false. The default value is false. When true, , , and are used in place of the . When false, QualityLevel, OverlapLevel, and SubsamplingLevel are set based on ImageQualityLevel.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.JpegXrEncoder.VerticalTileSlices
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two vertical regions.
member.value: The number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default value is 0.

remarks.para: If is true, VerticalTileSlices must be set to 0.
A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value will be adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size.
When used in combination with , a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both properties are set to 1, the image will be divided into 4 tiles.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.Wpf.Pdf.WpfPdfPopupWindow
member.summary: Interaction logic for WpfPdfPopupWindow.xaml

summary.para: This class is the window used for PDF annotations to allow their text to be modified.
The window is shown when the user double-clicks on a PDF annotation. When the window is closed, the property of the annotation is updated.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Annotate.Wpf.WpfAnnotationCanvas.SelectionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection mode to use when a mouse is clicked on an annotation.
member.value: The selection mode for annotations.
member.remarks: When this property is set to Multiple, multiple annotations can be selected by simply clicking on them. If you click on an annotation that is already selected, it will unselect the annotation.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Annotate.Wpf.WpfAnnotationCanvas.RotationSnapInterval
member.summary:
Gets or sets the interval used for snapping interactive rotation to degrees.
This is used to help users when rotating an annotation, making it easier to stop at whole degrees. The snap area is determined by the RotationSnapThreshold property.
member.value: The degree interval used for interactive rotation snapping.
member.remarks: This value must be from 0 to 180 and evenly divisible into 360. When setting this property the value will automatically be converted into a valid value.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Annotate.Wpf.WpfAnnotationCanvas.RotationSnapThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of deviation from the RotationSnapInterval that will be used to snap to the rotation interval.
member.value: The amount of deviation from the RotationSnapInterval.
member.remarks: This value must be from 0 to half the RotationSnapInterval. If the property is set to an invalid value it will be automatically corrected.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.Wpf.WpfCalloutAnnotation
member.summary:
This annotation is designed to provide additional information on a specific area of the document. It contains an editable text area and a leader line used to point to the area of the document.
When creating this annotation, the first click sets the target for the leader and centers the annotation over the target. With the mouse still pressed, drag the annotation to the desired location. Both annotation and leader point can be repositioned independently after the annotation has been created.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Annotate.Wpf.WpfHotSpotAnnotation
member.summary:
This annotations can be used to add rectangular hot spots on a document. When the InteractMode is set to View the hot spot annotations will be invisible but the cursor will change when hovering over it to indicate that area can be clicked.
For a non-rectangular area use the WpfHotSpotFreehandAnnotation.
